article_title: Presidential primary brings sheriff back into spotlight
article_text:
Continued from page 1

“I love it,” Arpaio said. “They pushed my polls up.” But he pointed out both Democrats mispronounced his name during their attacks.

Arpaio said he has stayed politically active over the last year through endorsements of other Republican candidates and GOP fundraising efforts.

He said he doesn’t worry his support is slipping among voters, even though his 2012 re-election race marked his second tightest election in his 23 years as sheriff. His closest challenger lost by 6 percentage points.

He dismissed criticism from opponents that he’s supporting Trump merely to garner media attention.

“I don’t need this controversy for attention,” the sheriff said. “I could have stayed out of this. Come on.”

article_metadata.description: First came the endorsement. Arizona's contentious Sheriff Joe Arpaio showered his support on Donald Trump, then campaigned for him ahead of the state presidential primary. He appeared on TV and at a huge rally with the Republican presidential front-runner in the lawman's hometown.
article_metadata.author: The Washington Times http://www.washingtontimes.com

“They pushed my polls up.” But he pointed out both Democrats mispronounced his name during their attacks.
“I don’t need this controversy for attention,” the sheriff said.
